title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Counternarcotics and Global Threats: Guatemala - Border Security, Ground and Maritime Interdiction, Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR)

description.narrative: The Office of the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Counternarcotics and Global Threats develops DoD counterdrug (CD) and counter-transnational organized crime (CTOC) policy. It also issues guidance, establishes priorities, and oversees resource allocation and program execution, for DoD CD and CTOC missions. These missions focus on countering illicit drug trafficking, but also include countering illicit financial flows and the illicit trafficking of people, wildlife, natural resources, and weapons. Primary activities include: coordinate and monitor DoD and interagency efforts for the detection and monitoring of the maritime and aerial transit of illegal drugs into the United States; direct, oversee, and monitor planning, programming, and budget (formulation, justification, and execution) processes for DoD Drug Interdiction and CD Activities programs, in coordination with other DoD Components; review, evaluate, coordinate, and monitor DoD CD and CTOC plans and programs to ensure adherence to approved policy and standards.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide
Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide

description.narrative: The Office of the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Counternarcotics and Global Threats develops DoD counterdrug (CD) and counter-transnational organized crime (CTOC) policy. It also issues guidance, establishes priorities, and oversees resource allocation and program execution, for DoD CD and CTOC missions. These missions focus on countering illicit drug trafficking, but also include countering illicit financial flows and the illicit trafficking of people, wildlife, natural resources, and weapons. Primary activities include: coordinate and monitor DoD and interagency efforts for the detection and monitoring of the maritime and aerial transit of illegal drugs into the United States; direct, oversee, and monitor planning, programming, and budget (formulation, justification, and execution) processes for DoD Drug Interdiction and CD Activities programs, in coordination with other DoD Components; review, evaluate, coordinate, and monitor DoD CD and CTOC plans and programs to ensure adherence to approved policy and standards.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Guatemala - Defense Management System Sustainment Workshop #6. Update and improve SIPLAGDE processes to more efficiently plan and execute Guatemalan budget resources. Update and improve GTTI Oversight of the SIPLAGDE Management process to more efficiently plan and execute Guatemalan budget resources. Develop links between GTTI-SIPLAGDE processes and the development of the MAGDEF. Work with the Office of DIGEPOL to assist the newly hired cost analyst to assume the duties as the partner nation SME on the development of HAGDEF to support MAGDEF and course development to train a cadre of cost analysts for the Guatemalan military. Develop links between GTTI-SIPLAGDE processes and the development of MAGDEF.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide
Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Guatemala - Defense Management System Sustainment Workshop #7. Support the critical evaluation of the policy directives governing GTTI and SIPLAGDE being conducted by the Ministry of Defense and the General Staff GTTI/SIPLAGDE technical working group to ensure firm process linkages between strategic planning and programming and to integrate the GTTI governing body to perform oversight of the system.Support the development of the Analytical Methodology for Defense Management (MAGDEF) courses as part of a structured approach to implementing a variety of tools within the analysis of competitive and strategic decisions throughout the Guatemalan defense resource investment process.
